channel.title: Client jarring/signing
channel.description: can anyone here tell me how to sign and jar a 317 server not 562 or higher

item.title: Client jarring/signing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:428632”]Most clients auto set the cache to look in C:/ anyways.
My auto cache downloader does.[/quote]

Then you restrict usage of your client to Windows-only machines.

And I don’t know what “cache downloader” you’re using, but I’m using the JAGGRAB protocol.

Read full topic

item.title: Client jarring/signing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Most clients auto set the cache to look in C:/ anyways.

item.title: Client jarring/signing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:428632”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=531323.msg3881946#msg3881946 date=1326089062]
I don’t think anyone needs to sign the client in order for it to work in an applet.

EDIT: Confirmed, there is (almost) no reason to sign the jar. The only reason to sign the jar is to access restricted parts of the system that are restricted with the SecurityManager (for example, accessing the user.home property).

Although, it’s still not difficult to sign the jar anyway.
[/quote]
Mopar honestly frowns upon signing a jar for that reason exactly. when you sign it, it has more access then needed. So just honestly fuck signing it and jar it.
Theres hundreds of jarring tuts out there. pick one and use it
We are not a spoon feed community.[/quote]

Yes, while signing the jar allows the SecurityManager to do more, it also allows you more flexibility. Such as referencing the cache location via

System.getProperty("user.home") + "/.file_store_32/";

The “user.home” property is restriced in unsigned applets, but without signing it, you have to manually set the cache location based on the operating system.

Read full topic

item.title: Client jarring/signing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:3, topic:428632”]I don’t think anyone needs to sign the client in order for it to work in an applet.

EDIT: Confirmed, there is (almost) no reason to sign the jar. The only reason to sign the jar is to access restricted parts of the system that are restricted with the SecurityManager (for example, accessing the user.home property).

Although, it’s still not difficult to sign the jar anyway.[/quote]
Mopar honestly frowns upon signing a jar for that reason exactly. when you sign it, it has more access then needed. So just honestly fuck signing it and jar it.
Theres hundreds of jarring tuts out there. pick one and use it
We are not a spoon feed community.

Read full topic

item.title: Client jarring/signing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I don’t think anyone needs to sign the client in order for it to work in an applet.

EDIT: Confirmed, there is (almost) no reason to sign the jar. The only reason to sign the jar is to access restricted parts of the system that are restricted with the SecurityManager (for example, accessing the user.home property).

Although, it’s still not difficult to sign the jar anyway.
